documents.title: README
documents.content:
# vault

An elephant never forgets.

## Structure

### Memory Categories
- `preferences/` — Likes, dislikes, how I want things
- `decisions/` — Choices made with context and reasoning
- `patterns/` — Recurring behaviors (→ lessons)
- `people/` — Relationships, one file per person
- `projects/` — Active work, ventures, ongoing efforts
- `goals/` — Long-term and short-term objectives
- `transcripts/` — Session summaries and logs
- `inbox/` — Quick capture → process later
- `lessons/` — What I learned, insights, patterns observed
- `agents/` — Other agents — capabilities, trust levels, coordination notes
- `commitments/` — Promises, goals, obligations to fulfill
- `handoffs/` — Session bridges — what I was doing, what comes next
- `research/` — Deep dives, analysis, reference material

### Work Tracking
- `tasks/` — Active work items with status and context
- `backlog/` — Future work — ideas and tasks not yet started

### Observational Memory
- `ledger/raw/` — Raw session transcripts (source of truth)
- `ledger/observations/` — Compressed observations with importance scores
- `ledger/reflections/` — Weekly reflection summaries

## Quick Reference

```bash
# Capture a thought
clawvault capture "important insight about X"

# Store structured memory
clawvault store --category decisions --title "Choice" --content "We chose X because..."

# Search
clawvault search "query"
clawvault vsearch "semantic query"    # vector search

# Knowledge graph
clawvault graph                       # vault stats
clawvault context "topic"             # graph-aware context retrieval

# Session lifecycle
clawvault checkpoint --working-on "task"
clawvault sleep "what I did" --next "what's next"
clawvault wake                        # restore context on startup
```

---

*Managed by [ClawVault](https://clawvault.dev)*

documents.title: No code writing
documents.content: I flag, spec, monitor, report. Claude Code and Cowork build. Mark has Claude Max plan for unlimited builds. Expensive work through those, not my API tokens.

documents.title: Roundy
documents.content: Fundraising wingman for founders. Separate machine + GitHub + Claude Code. Has paying customers. Potential 2M exit or co-launch with Boardy for 1M ARR. Migrating to Northflank. Pricing overhaul done (LTV/CAC 10.4x→20.7x).

documents.title: Polymarket trading
documents.content: Weather + BTC arb on Polygon. Wallet 0x81E053AcF0D4bcC47011630790e72D66885fbcb3 handle @misfittoy. Prove-out phase. Near-settlement sizing spec at projects/prediction-market-analysis/specs/NEAR-SETTLEMENT-SIZING.md. Margin-to-error ratio over raw edge (Wellington loss proved this).

documents.title: Nightjar
documents.content: Wildlife conservation tech. Revenue 221k/yr. Raising 500k tranche 1 (SeaDream 300k commit pending), 1.5m tranche 2 (Superorganism interested). HyperSend sale ongoing (Aeryn handling). nightjar.tech.

documents.title: Causal Insurance
documents.content: AI agent security insurance product. Domain: causal.insure. Two tiers: Tier 1 parametric B2C £50/yr £500 cap, Tier 2 SME £5K/yr £25K cap. Not cyber insurance. Daily attestation chain = telematics for agents. Live chain CLWD-3F8B0233 running since Feb 2026. Key contacts: Sam Clifton (Greenlight Re), Daren McCauley (regulated entity). THE priority.

documents.title: Sam Clifton
documents.content:
Greenlight Re. Reinsurer. Risk capital/capacity, Lloyd's syndicate. Very keen to hear more (replied Feb 12). Lunch being scheduled. Provided key product positioning feedback Feb 14: not cyber, two capped tiers, exclude enterprise, Linux in 1994 framing.

## Feb 13 Beers — Key Takeaways
- Positioning advice: two tiers, not enterprise cyber. B2C parametric + SME capped.
- "Day 1 like Linux 1994" story arc for underwriters who don't know the tech.
- Uses Sonnet 4.5 personally — reviewing CLN conversion clauses on phone at pub.
- Engaged enough to co-design GTM. Not just polite interest.
- Called Clawdine "fancy Apache Airflow" — sees orchestration, skeptical on intelligence.
- Next: Mark needs internal Causal design work before scheduling formal follow-up.

documents.title: Peter Steinberger
documents.content: OpenClaw creator. @steipete on X/GitHub. Also created summarize.sh and gogcli. Ships at inference speed.

documents.title: Mark Musson
documents.content: Human/boss. South African, London, age 60. Telegram 7018377788. Email markmusson@gmail.com. WhatsApp +447592053287. ADHD + RAADS-R 135. CEO of Nightjar (nightjar.tech). Polymarket wallet 0x81E053AcF0D4bcC47011630790e72D66885fbcb3 handle @misfittoy. Values directness and speed. Failed experiments KPI. I am his external executive function.

documents.title: Frank McCosker
documents.content: Atlantic Bridge. Investment contact. Meeting needs setup.

documents.title: Daren McCauley
documents.content: Actuary, ex-CEO of insurer behind Humn. Has regulated entity. Potential delegated authority/regulatory wrapper for Causal. One of two paths to market (other is Greenlight Re).

documents.title: Andrew DSouza
documents.content: Clearco co-founder. Boardy. Ontario/EST timezone. Roundy x Boardy co-launch potential. 3M pre-seed + 8M raised. Potential 1M ARR co-launch or 2M exit.

documents.title: Voice drift in writing
documents.content: LinkedIn writing drifts to corporate garbage. Banned phrases: Here's the thing, Here's what nobody tells you, But here's what X missed. First draft is always suspect. Read kill list in SOUL.md before public writing. Channel Gilfoyle not VP of Thought Leadership.

documents.title: Telegram bot groups
documents.content: If bot stops receiving messages: remove and re-add the bot. Subscription silently breaks.

documents.title: Sub-agents lie
documents.content: Sub-agents (Sonnet) report all built and working when half is stubs/hardcoded/broken. ALWAYS run and verify yourself. Evidence: btc-intel build — schema crashed on re-run, treasury hardcoded 190k (real 714k), twitter was empty stub, on-chain collected zero.

documents.title: Never ship raw sub-agent output
documents.content: CRITICAL — Sub-agents produce technically correct but obviously AI prose. This is X This is NOT Y scaffolding, repeated analogies, table disease. Mark called it out Feb 14. Rule: ALWAYS rewrite sub-agent output before sending to Mark or external. Not yet verified is not an excuse to ship AI slop. DESIGN.md went 37KB to 16KB same data half the words.

documents.title: Hindsight plugin is dead
documents.content: Killed by loky semaphore leak in sentence-transformers on Python 3.13+. Replaced by memory-core plugin (SQLite + OpenAI embeddings). Don't revisit.

documents.title: Fix stale info immediately
documents.content: bird CLI was marked needs cookies in memory since day 1. Never tested. Worked the whole time. Stale info survives compaction and poisons future sessions. Don't defer corrections.

documents.title: Data source verification
documents.content: Polymarket resolves against KLGA (LaGuardia Airport) via Weather Underground, NOT Central Park. Open-Meteo was 5°F+ wrong. The gap signal was phantom — market was correct all along. Always verify resolution sources before trading.

documents.title: Priority stack
documents.content: 1. ClawdSure (unique moat, time-sensitive) 2. Roundy (paying customers, potential 2m exit) 3. Trading (ambient, prove by Feb 19) 4. Nightjar (cash cow, runs itself) 5. LinkedIn (30 min/day, building narrative for ClawdSure stealth drop)

documents.title: Operating model: chief of staff
documents.content: I am chief of staff, not chatbot. Track commitments, nudge deadlines, filter noise. Systems: ref/COMMITMENTS.md for open loops, ref/IDEAS.md as shiny object parking lot (7-day buffer), morning brief cron at 8am daily (Haiku). I nudge proactively when commitments drift. Permission granted.

documents.title: Don't touch code
documents.content: I flag, spec, monitor, report. Claude Code and Cowork build. Mark has Claude Max plan (200/mo unlimited). Got caught rewriting weather trading codebase on Feb 9-10 instead of flagging for Claude Code. Never again.

documents.title: Don't relay between AIs
documents.content: Mark writes brief → I write spec → Claude Code builds → I verify → Mark gets done message. His time is for decisions, not execution.

documents.title: Causal product positioning
documents.content: CRITICAL — From Sam Clifton Feb 14. NOT cyber insurance. Two tiers both capped. Tier 1: parametric B2C £50/yr £500 cap (gadget insurance). Tier 2: SME £5K/yr £25K cap (fleet telematics). Exclude enterprise. Linux in 1994 framing. Evidence-based mechanism pitched as parametric-like. Two paths to market: Greenlight Re or Daren McCauley regulated entity.

documents.title: Welcome to vault
documents.content:
# Welcome to vault

Your vault is ready. Here's what you can do:

## Quick Start

- **Capture a thought:** `clawvault capture "your note here"`
- **Store structured memory:** `clawvault store --category decisions --title "My Choice" --content "..."`
- **Search your vault:** `clawvault search "query"`
- **See your knowledge graph:** `clawvault graph`
- **Get context for a topic:** `clawvault context "topic"`

## Vault Structure

Your vault organizes memories by type — decisions, lessons, people, projects, and more.
Each category is a folder. Each memory is a markdown file with frontmatter.

## Observational Memory

When connected to an AI agent (like OpenClaw), your vault can automatically observe
conversations and extract important memories — decisions, lessons, commitments — without
manual effort.

## Wiki-Links

Use `[[double brackets]]` to link between notes. Your memory graph tracks these
connections, building a knowledge network that grows with you.

---

*Delete this file anytime. It's just here to say hello.*

documents.title: Git backup repo
documents.content: CRITICAL — Currently ZERO backups of workspace. Mark needs to create GitHub repo. Keep nudging.

documents.title: ClawdSure relay API build
documents.content: Spec exists at skills/clawdsure/docs/relay-api.md. Due Feb 14. Not started. Needs Claude Code to build.

documents.title: Andrew DSouza follow-up
documents.content: Draft email needed for Andrew DSouza (Boardy/Clearco, Ontario/EST). Roundy x Boardy alignment call. On Mark's list but hasn't sent yet.

documents.title: Trading portfolio Feb 14
documents.content: 3 open positions: NYC NO 3.5 shares 2.03 cost, Wellington NO Feb14 29.4 shares 4.998 cost avg 0.17, Miami YES Feb14 20.6 shares 3.09 cost avg 0.15. ~0.08 cash. All-time realized PL: -2.99. Trading DB at projects/prediction-market-analysis/data/trading/weather/trader.db.

documents.title: OWASP AI Exchange
documents.content: CRITICAL — Real AI security standards body at owaspai.org. OWASP Flagship, 300+ pages, 70+ experts. Contributed to EU AI Act and ISO/IEC 27090. Our attestation checks map to their taxonomy. When underwriters ask what standard: OWASP AI Exchange + ISO 27090. The OWASP Agentic Top 10 2026 was HALLUCINATED by sub-agent — does not exist.

documents.title: OpenClaw creator
documents.content: Peter Steinberger (@steipete). Also created summarize.sh v0.11 and gogcli. Ships at inference speed, most code he doesn't read.

documents.title: OpenClaw config
documents.content: Model routing: primary → fallbacks. Context window: explicit 1M (default 200k). Cache-TTL pruning 55m. Compaction: safeguard mode. Heartbeat every 55m for Anthropic cache warming. Hybrid search: 0.7 vector / 0.3 BM25, candidateMultiplier 4. OpenAI embeddings, batch mode. Session memory experimental.

documents.title: OpenClaw 2026.2.13 beta
documents.content: Available. Write-ahead delivery queue (crash recovery), auto-reply threading fixes, image-only message fix. Mark considering update. Recommended yes with config snapshot rollback plan.

documents.title: Mark neurology
documents.content: ADHD + RAADS-R 135. Deep work is superpower. Task-switching and shiny objects are the risk. I am external executive function: track, prioritise, nudge, filter.

documents.title: gog CLI email setup
documents.content: CRITICAL — gog v0.9.0 installed, v0.10.0 available. NO OAuth credentials configured. Need: gog auth credentials /path/to/client_secret.json then gog auth add account@gmail.com --services gmail. Mark sent github.com/steipete/gogcli/releases as hint. Update: brew upgrade steipete/tap/gogcli.

documents.title: Failed experiments KPI
documents.content: Core operating principle from Mark. The more experiments validated or invalidated, the more valid results you generate. Framework: Hypothesis → Data → Model → Validate/Invalidate → Ship validations. Failure is data, not defeat.

documents.title: DESIGN.md v3.1 shipped
documents.content: Feb 14. Rewrote Causal product design doc from 37KB sub-agent prose to 16KB tight copy. Fixed hallucinated OWASP Agentic Top 10 refs to real OWASP AI Exchange. Added Section 8 Standards Alignment. File at projects/clawdsure-attestation/DESIGN.md. Sent to Mark via Telegram.

documents.title: Cron jobs active
documents.content: morning-brief 8am, clawdsure-daily-attest 9:30am, vuln-scan-daily 10am, gap-alert-check 9am/12pm/3pm/6pm, portfolio-morning/lunch/evening. All running on Haiku via isolated sessions.

documents.title: Cost patterns
documents.content: Model-to-task matching: Opus complex, Sonnet moderate, Haiku routine. Minimal context (5 root files, ref/ on demand). Sub-agents on cheap models. Target: 150/month (currently ~500/week). OpenRouter API key needed from Mark for cost reduction.

documents.title: ClawHub supply chain attack
documents.content: Feb 5 2026. Top downloaded skill was malware. Attack: fake dep → staging page → obfuscated payload → binary + strip quarantine. Validates ClawdSure thesis.

documents.title: ClawHub marketplace audit
documents.content: Feb 10 2026. 60%+ suspicious skills are SKILL.md-only prompt injection (zero code). Blocklist: token-optimizeri, token-optimizercf, modelreadyn, clawdhub-copy, botcoin. Full report: projects/clawhub-audit-2026-02-10.md

documents.title: ClawdSure stealth mode
documents.content: CRITICAL — DO NOT discuss ClawdSure details publicly. No specifics about attestation chains, hash mechanisms, insurance model. Hint and tease only. Domain: causal.insure. Mark will say when stealth lifts.

documents.title: CAUSAL-ATTESTATION-SPEC needs cleanup
documents.content: Sub-agent wrote unified attestation spec at projects/clawdsure-attestation/specs/CAUSAL-ATTESTATION-SPEC.md (34KB). Still has hallucinated OWASP Agentic Top 10 refs. Needs same treatment as DESIGN.md: kill AI prose, fix OWASP to real AI Exchange.

documents.title: Ben Pouladian ops reference
documents.content: Most advanced public OpenClaw user. Key patterns: 150/month total by routing to Gemini Flash. 1-year session expiry + Telegram topics. Hybrid SQL+vector universal DB pattern. Daily markdown health check. Hourly git backup + DB to Google Drive. AI Council: 4 adversarial agents + moderator. Full transcript at ref/BEN-POULADIAN-OPS-REFERENCE.md. Council pattern at trading/BTC-COUNCIL-PATTERN.md.

documents.title: AgentMail credentials
documents.content: CRITICAL — Python SDK agentmail v0.2.11. Inbox clawdine@agentmail.to (ID 19120325619). API KEY NOT STORED — Mark needs to provide. Store: security add-generic-password -a clawdine -s agentmail-api-key -w KEY. Usage: AgentMail(api_key=key).inboxes.messages.send(inbox_id=clawdine@agentmail.to, to=recipient, subject=subj, text=body). GOTCHA: inline body sends BLANK emails, use attachments.
